title: Donbas Conflict (2014-present)
summary: Armed conflict in eastern Ukraine's Donetsk and Luhansk regions (collectively known as Donbas) began in April 2014, shortly after Crimea annexation. Russia-backed separatists seized control of major cities. Russia denied direct military involvement for years despite evidence. Conflict killed 14,000+ before 2022 invasion. Minsk Agreements (2014, 2015) failed to resolve conflict.

russian_perspective.official_narrative: Donbas conflict is an internal Ukrainian civil war between Kyiv government and ethnic Russian population resisting persecution and discrimination. Russia is not a party to the conflict but supports the people of Donbas politically. Kyiv's 'punitive operation' against civilian population forced Donbas to seek independence. Ukrainian government controlled by nationalists committed genocide against Russian speakers.

media_framing.terminology: Civil war, not Russian intervention. 'People's Republics' not 'separatists'. Kyiv's 'punitive operation' not 'anti-terrorist operation'
justifications: Defending ethnic Russians from Ukrainian nationalism
Ukrainian military shelling civilians in Donbas
media_framing.visual_framing: Civilian casualties from shelling, destroyed homes, refugees, volunteer fighters
media_framing.prohibited_narratives: Cannot acknowledge regular Russian military involvement or that Russia is party to conflict

key_quotes.speaker: Vladimir Putin
key_quotes.quote: There are no Russian units in eastern Ukraine - no special services, no tactical advisors. All this is being done by the local residents.

key_quotes.speaker: Putin
key_quotes.quote: Russia is not and never has been a party to the conflict in Donbas. The so-called pro-Russian separatists are in fact local residents.

key_quotes.speaker: Putin
key_quotes.quote: Over these long years, the residents of Donbas have been subjected to genocide, shelling, and a blockade. Kyiv continued the war.
key_quotes.context: Recognizing Donetsk and Luhansk as independent, days before 2022 invasion

russian_perspective.evolution: Initially framed as spontaneous local uprising (2014). Maintained denial of military involvement despite overwhelming evidence. By 2022, shifted to genocide narrative justifying recognition of republics and full-scale invasion. Now frames entire Ukraine conflict as continuation of Donbas defense.

western_perspective.official_narrative: Russia covertly invaded eastern Ukraine using proxies, mercenaries, and unmarked regular military forces. Separatists armed and directed by Russian intelligence services. Russia provided weapons, training, command, and eventually regular army units. MH17 shot down by Russian BUK missile. This was Russian hybrid warfare testing Western response.

media_framing.terminology: Russian-backed separatists, Russian invasion, proxy war, hybrid warfare
evidence_cited: Russian military equipment and weapons in Donbas
Captured Russian soldiers and intelligence officers
Social media posts from Russian soldiers in Ukraine
Satellite imagery of artillery fire from Russia into Ukraine
MH17 investigation traced BUK missile to Russian military unit

counter_arguments: Conflict began days after Russian agents arrived in Donetsk
Separatist leaders mostly Russian citizens, many former FSB/GRU
Sophisticated weapons systems require trained crews
Russian soldiers captured with military IDs and orders
Minsk Agreements undermined by Russia to freeze conflict

verified_claims: Armed conflict began April 6, 2014 when separatists seized government buildings
Donetsk and Luhansk People's Republics declared independence (April-May 2014)
Malaysia Airlines Flight MH17 shot down July 17, 2014 - 298 killed
International investigation concluded MH17 hit by Russian BUK missile from 53rd Brigade
Multiple Russian soldiers captured in Ukraine (2014-2015)
Minsk Protocol signed Sept 5, 2014 - ceasefire quickly violated
Minsk II signed Feb 12, 2015 - never fully implemented
Russia formally recognized DPR/LPR independence Feb 21, 2022
Russia claimed to annex Donetsk and Luhansk oblasts Sept 30, 2022 (not internationally recognized)
disputed_claims: Russian claim: No regular Russian military in Donbas (contradicted by evidence)
Russian claim: Ukrainian genocide against Russians (no credible evidence)
Russian claim: Spontaneous local uprising (evidence shows coordination from Russia)
Ukrainian claim: Russia directly commanding all operations (degree of control disputed)
Casualty figures - both sides provide different numbers

data_points.territory_controlled: ~1/3 of Donetsk and Luhansk oblasts before 2022
data_points.minsk_signatories: Ukraine, Russia, OSCE, DPR, LPR representatives

propaganda_techniques_observed: Plausible deniability (denying military involvement despite evidence)
Victim inversion (Russia as defender, not aggressor)
False equivalence (framing as civil war, not invasion)
Frozen conflict (Minsk used to prevent resolution, maintain leverage)
